title: How to Make Eyeball Cake Pops

steps.headline: Put all your dry ingredients in a large bowl mix well.
steps.description: Stir together your cocoa powder, flour, sugar, salt, baking soda and baking powder until well combined.

steps.headline: Put in your wet ingredients with your dry mix until it forms a pudding consistency.
steps.description: Add in your milk and brewed coffee to the dry ingredient mixture.

steps.headline: Pour your mixture into cake pop pans or mini cupcake pans.
Bake your cake pops for 20 minutes.
Use your hands to shape the cake pops into round balls
Dip your cake pop sticks into the melted white chocolate and allow the chocolate to dry.
Push the sticks into your cake pops once they are dry.
steps.description: Then dip the cake pops into the white chocolate.

steps.headline: Shake off the excess white chocolate and place on your blue candy melt (or any other color) and place it on when it's still wet.
Use the black candy melt to paint on a pupil.
Paint on veins with red candy melt.
Let the cake pops cool down a bit and dig in!

text: Put all your dry ingredients in a large bowl mix well. Stir together your cocoa powder, flour, sugar, salt, baking soda and baking powder until well combined. Put in your wet ingredients with your dry mix until it forms a pudding consistency. Add in your milk and brewed coffee to the dry ingredient mixture. Pour your mixture into cake pop pans or mini cupcake pans. Preheat your oven to 350F (180C). Bake your cake pops for 20 minutes.  Use your hands to shape the cake pops into round balls  Dip your cake pop sticks into the melted white chocolate and allow the chocolate to dry.  Push the sticks into your cake pops once they are dry. Then dip the cake pops into the white chocolate. Shake off the excess white chocolate and place on your blue candy melt (or any other color) and place it on when it's still wet.  Use the black candy melt to paint on a pupil.  Paint on veins with red candy melt.  Let the cake pops cool down a bit and dig in!  Finished.
